page.title: 13Geology
page.content: The northwest corner of the square is limestone, a fault separates this from Skiddaw slate which takes up most of the remaining area. The river Cocker runs through the slate area. To the south and then to the north of this fault(from left to right)the rocks are Cockermouth lava which goes down as far as 300 ft. On the north side of the river the basement rock is conglomerate. Watch Hill is mostly Grits Skiddaw slate which is comprised of alternate layers of massive grits and sandstones interbedded with silty sandstones. On the very top of the hill there is some diorite.
